meanings.definition: Grain used as feed for livestock.
meanings.sent1: The farmer stored the feedgrain in the barn for the cows.
meanings.sent2: The chickens pecked at the feedgrain scattered on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to juggle the feedgrain but ended up making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The field of golden feedgrain swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh feedgrain filled the air, enticing the hungry animals.

meanings.sent1: The farmer will feedgrain the horses after they finish their exercise.
meanings.sent2: She carefully feedgrain the rabbits in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to play a game where they pretend to feedgrain imaginary animals.
meanings.sent4: The kind neighbor always offers to feedgrain the pets when their owners are away.
meanings.sent5: In the winter, it's important to regularly feedgrain the livestock to keep them healthy.

meanings.definition: The act of feeding animals with grain.
meanings.sent1: The feedgrain of the horses was a daily task for the stable hand.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the peacefulness of the feedgrain process on the farm.
meanings.sent3: During the farm festival, there was a contest for the fastest feedgrain in the county.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of feedgrain in the trough was soothing to the animals.
meanings.sent5: The abundance of feedgrain in the silo ensured the animals never went hungry.
